description: Translucent white to colorless phenakite showing a blocky, prismatic habit with subtle longitudinal striations and a vitreous to slightly greasy luster. Phenakite is a beryllium silicate typically occurring in granitic pegmatites and hydrothermal veins; pieces may appear massive or as short prisms when crystal faces are incomplete.
notes: ID is based on user context and general appearance; many white translucent minerals can look similar in photos. Confirm with hardness (should scratch quartz), lack of cleavage (conchoidal/uneven fracture), and specific gravity near ~3.0.
